snippet.title: Jen: Is It OK to Say No to Sugar?
snippet.description: When James was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes, I started feeling like he NEEDED to eat sugar, if for no other reason than to show the world that kids with type 1 CAN eat sugar.

snippet.title: Jen: Blood Sugar Is Just a Number (a How-To)
snippet.description: It's tough but important not to automatically do a fist pump at a good number, just like we shouldn't swear when we hit one of those not-so-good numbers.

snippet.title: Rolled Sugar Cookies
snippet.description: No holiday is complete without rolled and cut sugar cookies! Try Anne Coleman's delicious recipe today.

snippet.title: Classic Sugar Cookie Dough
snippet.description: Need a go-to sugar cookie recipe? This dough is tasty and holds it shape well during baking, which makes it a great choice for cut-out cookies!

snippet.title: Poison Apple Cookies
snippet.description: Covered with sweet green frosting, instead of potion, these Halloween cookies are equally tempting.

snippet.title: People in the Know: Nighttime Blood Sugar Checks
snippet.description: Find tips for parents on managing overnight blood sugar in children with type 1 diabetes.

snippet.title: Cut That: Simple Ways to Slash Sugar
Holiday Sugar Cookies
snippet.description: No Holiday cookie tray is complete without traditional cut-out sugar cookies. This is a simple recipe that rolls easily and bakes up delicious cookies perfect for decorating. Get Anne Coleman's great recipe here.

snippet.title: Jen: Happiness Is Knowing the Right Carb Count!
snippet.description: When it comes to special occasion foods, I find that if I make them myself, know the ingredients, and weigh them on my scale ahead of time, I can keep James' blood sugar in a much better range.

snippet.title: Bitter Sweet
snippet.description: How Sugar Intake Is Directly Linked To Illness
